title: Authors and Citation
text: Clarke J, Wiemken T (2022). tidyiddr: Provides downloads IDDR Data. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/QuartzSoftwareLLC/tidyiddr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tidyiddr: Provides downloads of the IDDR Data},   author = {Jacob Clarke and Timothy Wiemken},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/QuartzSoftwareLLC/tidyiddr}, }

what: Provides downloads of the IDDR Data
title: Provides downloads of the IDDR Data
text: Every epidimiological question relies data. Infectious Disease Repository provides location data analytical resources various infectious etiologies. website developed maintained Jacob Clarke Quartz Software LLC.

title: Provides downloads of the IDDR Data
code: remotes::install_github("quartzsoftwarellc/tidyiddr")

title: Provides downloads of the IDDR Data
text: Information datasets can found Infectious Disease Data Repository
code: data <- tidyiddr::misc()

title: breakthrough — breakthrough
text: Breakthrough State Breakthrough data scraped multiple states daily. Contains information vaccinated vs unvaccinated hospitalizations COVID cases. information available Quartz Software Infection Disease Data Repository Breakthrough State Breakthrough data scraped multiple states daily. Contains information vaccinated vs unvaccinated hospitalizations COVID cases. information available Quartz Software Infection Disease Data Repository

title: breakthrough — breakthrough
code: breakthrough(use_memory = T, use_disk = T, bust_cache = F, ...)  breakthrough(use_memory = T, use_disk = T, bust_cache = F, ...)

title: breakthrough — breakthrough
text: use_memory Whether use memory caching. use_disk Whether use disk caching. bust_cache Whether bust (refresh) cache. ... arguments forward cache_download function.

title: breakthrough — breakthrough
text: function uses cache_download function download data repository. function uses cache_download function download data repository.

title: breakthrough — breakthrough
code: data <- breakthrough() #> Warning: One or more parsing issues, see `problems()` for details  data <- breakthrough() #> [1] "Reading from disk cache" #> Rows: 854 Columns: 16 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr   (3): source, granularity, vaccine_type #> dbl  (12): hospitalizations_unvaccinated_per_100k, hospitalizations_vaccinat... #> date  (1): start_date #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Cache Download — cache_download
text: default, downloads cached disk computer memory. means second time download file session reloaded ram. stop session restart , file loaded disk. want reload data original source, use bust_cache function.

title: Cache Download — cache_download
code: cache_download(   url,   ...,   use_memory = TRUE,   use_disk = TRUE,   bust_cache = FALSE )

title: Cache Download — cache_download
text: url URL download . ... arguments forward vroom::vroom function. use_memory Whether use memory caching. use_disk Whether use disk caching. bust_cache Whether bust (refresh) cache.

title: Cache Download — cache_download
text: Additionally, options can used determine default caching behavior tidyiddr.
